png

Class PngDatePatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.PngDatePatcher

  • public final class PngDatePatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs surgical patching of PNG files by targeting specific metadata chunks (eXIf, iTXt, tIME, and tEXt).

    This class performs surgical updates that preserve the original file size. It maintains structural integrity by padding new dates with nulls (EXIF) or spaces (XMP) to match the existing byte count. Every change triggers an automatic CRC recalculation to ensure the PNG remains technically valid. 

        *** Tips for exiftool commands ***
 
    Delete all XMP items
    exiftool -XMP:all= XMPimage.png 
    
    Add dates to XMP
    exiftool.exe -all= -XMP-exif:DateTimeOriginal="2024:01:01 12:00:00" -XMP-xmp:CreateDate="2024:01:01 12:00:00"  -XMP-xmp:ModifyDate="2024:01:01 12:00:00" XMPimage.png
                            OR
    exiftool.exe "-XMP:CreateDate=2001:11:12 10:10:10" XMPimage.png
    exiftool.exe "-XMP:ModifyDate=2001:11:12 10:10:10" XMPimage.png 
    exiftool.exe "-XMP-exif:DateTimeOriginal=2004:11:12 10:10:10" XMPimage.png
        
    List metadata
    exiftool.exe -G -a -s XMPimage.png    
    
    Check if tIME chunk exists
    exiftool.exe -PNG:ModificationTime -G1 -s XMPimage.png  
    
    Add ModifyDate to tIME chunk 
    exiftool.exe "-PNG:ModifyDate=2023:10:10 10:10:10" XMPimage.png
    
    Add to textual chunk for CreateDate
    exiftool.exe "-PNG:CreationTime=2023:10:10 10:10:10" XMPimage.png
    
    exiftool.exe -AllDates="2023:10:10 10:10:10" -PNG:ModifyDate="2023:10:10 10:10:10" -PNG:CreationTime="2023:10:10 10:10:10" XMPimage.png
    
    Print out all time entries
    exiftool.exe -a -G1 -s -Time:All XMPimage.png
    Since:
    5 February 2026
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Detail

      • patchAllDates

        public static void patchAllDates(java.nio.file.Path imagePath,
                                 java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime newDate,
                                 boolean xmpDump)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Manages the patching of all detectable date metadata within a PNG file.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - the path to the PNG file
        newDate - the replacement date and time
        xmpDump - indicates whether to dump XMP data into an XML-formatted file for debugging, if the data is present. If true, a file is created based on the image name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is inaccessible or structured incorrectly

      • processExifSegment

        private static void processExifSegment(ChunkHandler handler,
                                       ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Surgically patches date tags within the eXIf chunk by parsing the embedded TIFF structure. This method respects the TIFF segment's native byte order (Little vs Big Endian) while performing in-place overwrites.

        Special handling is applied to GPS date stamps to ensure they are recorded in UTC, as outlined in the GPS specification.

        Parameters:
        handler - the chunk handler containing parsed metadata segments
        writer - the writer used to perform the in-place modification
        zdt - the new date and time to be applied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs whilst accessing the file or parsing the TIFF data

      • processXmpSegment

        private static void processXmpSegment(ChunkHandler handler,
                                      ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                      java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt,
                                      boolean xmpDump)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Scans XML content within iTXt chunks for date tags and performs binary overwrites. It maps character indices to physical byte offsets to prevent drift caused by multi-byte UTF-8 characters and pads shorter strings with spaces to maintain fixed offsets.
        Parameters:
        handler - the active chunk
        writer - the writer used to perform the in-place modification
        zdt - the target date and time to be applied
        xmpDump - if true, exports the raw XMP payload to a file for inspection purposes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs whilst accessing the file or overwriting data

      • processTimeSegment

        private static void processTimeSegment(ChunkHandler handler,
                                       ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Surgically patches the standard PNG tIME chunk using a 7-byte big-endian representation.
        Parameters:
        handler - the PNG chunk handler containing parsed chunks
        writer - the writer used for in-place modification
        zdt - the new date and time to apply
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • processTextualChunk

        private static void processTextualChunk(ChunkHandler handler,
                                        ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                        java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Surgically patches standard tEXt chunks to update date-related keywords.

        This method identifies chunks like Creation Time, performs a binary overwrite within the existing slot width using ISO-8859-1 encoding, and updates the CRC.

        Parameters:
        handler - the metadata handler containing parsed chunks
        writer - the writer used for in-place modification
        zdt - the new date and time to apply
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • updateChunkCRC

        private static void updateChunkCRC(ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                   PngChunk chunk,
                                   byte[] updatedPayload)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Updates the CRC checksum for a specific chunk to ensure the file remains valid after a surgical patch. The calculation encompasses both the 4-byte Type identifier and the modified Data segment.

        This method ensures the byte order is set to Big Endian for the CRC write operation, as defined by the PNG specification, before reverting to the original byte order to maintain logical consistency.

        Parameters:
        writer - the file writer positioned for patching
        chunk - the PngChunk being updated
        updatedPayload - the newly patched payload
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs whilst accessing the file stream
